verdict: Conversion tracking pollution is undermining smart bidding and inflating reported performance

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 5 conversion actions configured

checks.name: Enhanced conversions enabled
checks.finding: Cannot confirm enhanced conversions status from available data

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Add to basket set as Primary (micro conversion). YouTube subscriptions and YouTube follow-on views set as Primary (completely irrelevant to e-commerce). This pollutes smart bidding with non-purchase signals

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: GA4 purchase has dynamic values, but micro conversions as Primary inflate conversion counts without real revenue

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: YouTube subs and follow-on views counted as Primary conversions alongside purchases — massively inflates conversion count

checks.name: GA4 linked and flowing
checks.finding: GA4 purchase action is Primary and tracking revenue

checks.name: Call tracking setup
checks.finding: Calls from ads is NOT set as Primary — should be Primary for a D2C brand with phone orders. YouTube actions ARE Primary but shouldn't be

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Brand search campaign active but search term review cadence unknown

checks.name: Negative keyword lists exist
checks.finding: Unable to verify negative keyword list coverage from available data

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: PMax Remarketing campaign: $1,642 spend for only $702 value (0.43x ROAS). Non-brand Shopping campaigns combined: $1,063 spend for $1,482 value (1.39x ROAS) — below target

checks.name: Zero-conversion products
checks.finding: Non-brand Shopping campaigns have very low conversion volume (14.2 conv total) relative to spend ($1,063)

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: Consistent CTM prefix across all active campaigns

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 83 total campaigns with 78 paused — extreme campaign bloat indicating multiple strategy changes and agency handoffs

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: Brand Search campaign separated from Non-Brand Shopping campaigns

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: PMax campaign active with brand terms

checks.name: Search + PMax overlap
checks.finding: Brand Search and PMax +Brand running simultaneously — potential cannibalization

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: 60% of budget ($11,968) goes to PMax +Brand which has 1.47x ROAS. Non-brand Shopping has better unit economics but gets only $1,063

checks.name: Brand keyword Quality Score
checks.finding: Brand search achieving 21.5% CTR — indicates strong QS on brand terms

checks.name: Keyword coverage
checks.finding: Only brand terms actively targeted in Search. No non-brand search expansion

checks.name: Match type distribution
checks.finding: Unable to assess match types from available data — recommend reviewing brand campaign for close variant leakage

checks.name: RSA ad count per ad group
checks.finding: Brand search RSA setup not verified from available data

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: Brand CTR 21.5% is excellent. PMax CTR 0.9% is typical for PMax

checks.name: PMax audience signals
checks.finding: Separate Remarketing PMax exists but underperforming at 0.43x ROAS — audience signals may need refinement

checks.name: PMax brand cannibalization
checks.finding: PMax +Brand campaign running alongside Brand Search — PMax likely cannibalizing cheaper brand clicks

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: All campaigns use smart bidding (Max Conv Value or Max Conversions)

checks.name: Target ROAS set appropriately
checks.finding: Non-brand Shopping uses Target ROAS but main PMax uses uncapped Max Conv Value — no floor on efficiency

checks.name: Budget constrained campaigns
checks.finding: Brand SIS 89.6% is strong. PMax SIS 44.2% suggests room to grow if ROAS improves. Shopping SIS ~40% limited by budget

checks.name: Sitelink extensions
checks.finding: Extension setup not verified from available data

checks.name: Audience segments applied
checks.finding: Remarketing PMax exists suggesting audiences are built, but performance is poor

quickWins.action: Set YouTube subscriptions and YouTube follow-on views to Secondary immediately — these are inflating conversion counts and misleading smart bidding
Set Add to basket to Secondary — micro conversion should not be Primary
Set Calls from ads to Primary — legitimate macro conversion being ignored
Pause PMax Remarketing Aim campaign — $1,642 spend at 0.43x ROAS is destroying value
Add brand exclusion to PMax +Brand campaign or consolidate with Brand Search to stop cannibalization
Set Target ROAS floor on PMax +Brand (start at 1.5x) to establish efficiency baseline

items: Clean conversion tracking: Only GA4 Purchase + Calls from ads as Primary. Everything else Secondary
Pause PMax Remarketing Aim campaign (0.43x ROAS)
Evaluate PMax +Brand vs Brand Search overlap — consider brand exclusion on PMax
Archive or delete the 78 paused campaigns to clean up account
After conversion cleanup, let smart bidding recalibrate for 2 weeks with clean data
Set Target ROAS on PMax +Brand (start at 1.5x, increase incrementally)
Expand non-brand Shopping — increase budgets on chicken & lamb and salmon campaigns that show positive ROAS
Test non-brand Search campaign for high-intent terms (e.g., 'buy dog food online australia')
Increase non-brand Shopping SIS from ~40% toward 60%+ on profitable products
Launch single consolidated PMax campaign with proper product segmentation
Build Customer Match list from existing customer database for better audience targeting
Test Demand Gen for upper-funnel pet owner targeting
